subject: Re: [junit] Re: Conditional tearDown()
msgSnippet: So far, I haven t needed to visually inspect the DB; I just want to keep that option open in the case of a test failure. WRT test dependencies, the pre-clean
messageBody:
So far, I haven't needed to visually inspect the DB; I just want to keep
that option open in the case of a test failure.

WRT test dependencies, the pre-clean approach amounts to having setUp()
having knowledge of what state should be cleaned-up to avoid perturbing its
testcase vs. having tearDown() having knowledge of what state was changed by
its testcase (so that it can clean up to avoid perturbing the next
testcase).

Kendall

> I could use a conditional clean-up in tearDown, for exactly the same
> reason as Brian.
>
> When I first ran into this issue; I didn't think of trying to make the
> tearDown() clean-up conditional. Instead, I adopted a convention of
> having my setUp()s perform the clean-up for the next test. In other
> words, for a given test I do a pre-clean instead of a post-clean.
> I'm not sure if that's good or bad...
